meanings.definition: Resembling long, slender hairs or bristles
meanings.sent1: The caterpillar had villiform hairs covering its body.
meanings.sent2: The plant had villiform leaves that swayed in the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The villiform grass looked like a tiny forest on the lawn.
meanings.sent4: Her villiform eyelashes fluttered like delicate wings.
meanings.sent5: The villiform strands of spaghetti tangled on the plate.

meanings.definition: Having a structure or appearance similar to that of villi
meanings.sent1: The villiform pattern on the fabric resembled tiny bumps.
meanings.sent2: The villiform texture of the coral felt rough to the touch.
meanings.sent3: The villiform clouds in the sky looked like fluffy cotton balls.
meanings.sent4: Her villiform scarf wrapped snugly around her neck.
meanings.sent5: The villiform design on the wallpaper created a sense of depth.
